title: Dental Front Office Manager
description:
**Job Overview**

We are seeking a highly skilled Dental Front Office Manager to join our dynamic healthcare team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing the day-to-day operations of our front office, ensuring seamless communication between patients, staff, and management. This role requires a strong understanding of healthcare management, a focus on providing exceptional patient care, and a keen eye for budgeting and practice management.

*This roles requires a full-time presence of 40 hours a week, Mondays half days starting at 12:45 pm and Tuesdays - Fridays full days starting at 7:45 am.* We are not hiring for temporary or part-time positions for this role.

**Duties**

- As the front office manager, you will be the "Maitre D'" of the patient-facing areas. Maintenance of the reception area and common areas where patients access the clinic (excluding clinical areas) will fall under your responsibility.  
- You will be supervising and directing a receptionist, while coordinating the schedule on a high level.  
- You will ensure that the front office runs efficiently and effectively, including managing patient flow, optimizing, and communicating billing and insurance claims questions to other team members. (You will NOT be responsible for submission and tracking of insurance claims, but should answer most insurance-related questions in a customer-facing capacity).  
- You will contribute to the development and implementation of policies and procedures to improve the overall patient experience and increase office productivity.  
- You will manage and maintain accurate records and reports, including patient information and billing data.  
- Based on your observations, you may will be reviewing existing trends to create scheduling and front office strategies to better optimize the schedule.  
- You are responsible for developing customer service goals, ensuring that all patients and families feel welcome and supported; and directing the receptionist to follow these goals.  
- Punctuality is important, therefore we value individuals who are able to follow our schedule and arrive to work on time in order to respect the schedules of our patients and fellow team members.  
- Finally, image is important! Please maintain a clean and organized work environment, adhering to all health and safety regulations.

**Qualifications**

- Associate's degree in a relevant field, such as healthcare management or dental assisting.  
- At least 2 years of experience in dentistry, preferably in dental administration.  
- Proven experience in patient management, including an understanding of dental reception and resolving common dental patient questions.  
- Understanding of TREATMENT PLANNING, dental insurances (PPO knowledge), and dental terminology  
- Excellent communication and leadership skills.  
- Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and prioritize tasks to meet deadlines.  
- Ability to work collaboratively with the external specialist and technician teams to achieve shared goals.  
- Strong attention to detail and organizational skills, with the ability to maintain accurate records and reports.  
- A passion for providing exceptional patient care and a commitment to ongoing learning and professional development.

**Position type**

This role starts as a 90-day position compensated biweekly as a 1099 contractor while we get to know each other and ensure a good long-term fit. After a probationary period of up to 90 days (can be reduced based on positive performance), a full-time W-2 permanent position may be extended. A permanent W-2 position includes such incentives as paid sick/PTO leave, paid holidays, and employer-contributed medical plan access. In order to convert to a W-2 position, you must have demonstrated good adherence to the roles and responsibilities during your probationary period. Continued 1099 status may also be kept per agreement of both parties.

**Interview process**

We will invite you two spend up to 4 days working with us over a two-week period. During these 4 days, you will be compensated as part of an active working interview. Please inform us of your hourly wage expectation when we schedule your working interview - you will be assessed fairly at the wage level you present to us. If a full-time position is offered, you will be offered the wage which you have listed. Therefore, we ask that you select a wage which will be agreeable and comfortable for you.

If you prefer to shadow rather than actively contribute during working interview, no remuneration will be offered as part of an observational/behavioral interview for that day.

Joining our team offers the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment where patient care is paramount. If you are a dedicated professional looking to contribute to a positive dental experience, we encourage you to apply for this position.

---

**About Us**

Arbor: A Dental Concept is a private practice in Long Island City, NY. We are inclusive, agile, and professional - *and seeking long-term partners in our growth.* As an unaffiliated, completely doctor-owned organization by Dr. Steven Lin, we are committed to objective, truthful performance of our responsibilities for the health and wellness of our patient community. We value strong ethics, an unwavering commitment to science, and a desire to outperform in the patient experience. We live by our slogan "artisanal, boutique, and concierge" and seek highly motivated individuals wishing to make an impact on an individual and system level.

Unique to the Arbor vision is the integration of a medical-dental model. Therefore, we have the expertise of accepting and integrating medical insurance as a form of dental reimbursement - a rare practice among dental clinics. We resist external sales and marketing pressures in order to deliver care with an unbiased perspective. To that end, we are truthful advocates for the patient's health and concerns.

Among some of the advanced offerings performed at Arbor by Dr. Steven Lin are: Invisalign orthodontics, cone-beam CT (CBCT) diagnosis, dental implant treatments, Chao Pinhole gum rejuvenation, cosmetic veneers, and full mouth rehabilitations.

We frequently work with certified external specialists and technicians to provide unparalleled technical delivery.

Joining Arbor means an steadfast commitment to the patient, whether assisting the patient in direct patient care or providing ancillary services such as insurance assistance. We share family values - not only in how we work amongst ourselves, but in how we expect and relate to our patients. We know that the patient experience starts and ends by interactions with members of the dental team, and we invite you to be part of their patient journeys.

description:
**$40,000 Student Loan Repayment Or $30,000 Sign-on Bonus For Individuals Who Have Not Previously Participated In This Program**  

**Flexible provider schedules available between 20-40 hours per week!**

  

  

Optum Home & Community Care, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, is creating something new in health care. We are uniting industry-leading solutions to build an integrated care model that holistically addresses an individual’s physical, mental and social needs – helping patients access and navigate care anytime and anywhere.

  

  

As a team member of our HouseCalls product, we provide annual clinical assessments to patients in the comfort of their homes. This important preventive care helps identify and reduce health risks for patients, in addition to coordinating appropriate follow-up care to improve health and well-being.

  

  

We’re connecting care to create a seamless health journey for patients across care settings. Join us to start **Caring. Connecting. Growing together.**

  

  

HouseCalls is a Nurse Practitioner led model of care designed around the person offers a fulfilling career where you can focus on what brought you into medicine: keeping patients healthy.

  

  

Providers perform annual clinical assessments to members in the comfort of their homes. HouseCalls visits are effective in reducing health risks, identifying acute issues, and connecting members to key support services. The Optum HouseCalls team had a 99%-member satisfaction rate in 2021.

  

  

In this role you will have the ability to achieve work life balance. Flexible scheduling offered where providers can flex their time over the 7-day work week. No on-call, no weekends and no holidays required.

  

  

OPTUM is transforming care delivery with innovative and personal care. As one of the largest employers of Advance Practice Clinicians, Optum offers unparalleled career development opportunities.

  

  

**Primary Responsibilities:**


* Conduct in-home assessments including an evaluation of past medical history, review of systems, medication reconciliation, vital signs, and comprehensive physical exam
* Perform evidence-based practice screenings including point of care testing (as appropriate)
* Identify diagnoses to be used in care management and active medical management in the furtherance of treatment
* Formulate a list of current and past medical conditions using clinical knowledge and judgment and the findings of your assessment
* Communicate findings in your assessment that will be used to inform member’s PCP of potential gaps in care
* Identify urgent and emergent situations and intervene appropriately
* Educate members on topics such as disease process, medication, and compliance

  

  

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

**Required Qualifications:**


* Active NP license or ability to obtain by start date. Licensure must be unencumbered, free of any open/unresolved disciplinary actions including probation or restrictions against privilege to practice
* Active ANCC or AANP national certification in Family, Geriatrics, Adult, Adult-Gerontology Primary Care, or Adult-Gerontology Acute Care certification, or the ability to obtain national certification and/or NP license in state of assignment by start date
* Ability to complete physical requirements of the job including lifting a 30-pound bag in and out of the car, navigating stairs and a variety of dwelling conditions, and sit, stand and kneel to perform physical assessment
* Reliable transportation to complete home visit assessments
* Fluency in Mandarin

  

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**


* 1+ years of clinical experience in their highest level of education, clinical setting
* May be requested to obtain additional licensure in other geographic areas
* Experience in gerontology, cardiology, internal medicine, or endocrinology
* Home Health care or home visit experience
* Ability to travel throughout the state, beyond your assigned region, up to 5% of the time. Based on business needs with advanced notice, eligible for additional compensation incentives

  


**New York Residents Only:** The salary range for this role is $88,000 to $173,200 annually. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. UnitedHealth Group complies with all minimum wage laws as applicable. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.

We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes - an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.*
